citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection there was no responsible, knowledgeable, and readily identifiable attendant or employee present
for the male camel and giraffe during periods of public contact. A couple (man and woman) approached the far-right side
of the camel’s enclosure and took turns petting and photographing themselves with him. Upon my approach to the
giraffe’s enclosure, there was a family (husband, wife, and child) petting the giraffe (in the area between his enclosure and
the arcade building). After the family left, the giraffe was also able to reach his head and neck out to where I was standing
(the same area as the family), providing me the opportunity to pet him without an attendant present. Lack of a
responsible, knowledgeable, and readily identifiable attendant or employee during periods of public contact, especially
since both animals are accustomed to public feedings, pose a significant risk to the health and well-being of both the
animals and the public. A responsible, knowledgeable, and readily identifiable attendant or employee must always be
present during periods of public contact.
Correct by: September 22, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
